p: The insects were placed in the flasks, which were closed and sealed with parafilm. After 48 h of exposure, the Petri dishes were removed from the flasks, which were covered with organza and packed in a B.O.D. type climatic chamber at 30 ± 2 °C and 70% relative humidity for 15 days. Adult F1 progeny, obtained in the feeding substrate, were counted and removed daily over 45 days from the emergence of the first insect.
